name: Chocolate Stout Cake
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dark chocolate chips ('}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'light corn syrup'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'heavy cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'rish cream liqueur ('}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1 (11.2', 'unit': 'ounce) bottle', 'name': 'stout beer ('}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 3/4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder ('}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking soda'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Make frosting: Place dark chocolate chips in a large bowl; set aside.. Combine 1 1/2 cups white sugar, water, and corn syrup in a light colored, tall-sided saucepan. Place pan over medium heat and cook until mixture begins to turn a deep amber color, swirling pan often to combine ingredients; about 15 minutes. Remove pan from heat and carefully pour in heavy cream (mixture will bubble up rapidly and then seize, this is ok). Place pan back over low heat and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Allow mixture to boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly, then immediately pour caramel over the chocolate chips. Allow mixture to stand for 1 minute.. Gently stir until chocolate is melted and smooth. Add in 2 teaspoons vanilla and Irish Cream and mix until combined. Add in butter 1 tablespoon at a time, making sure each addition is fully incorporated before adding the next, until all 3 tablespoons of butter are incorporated. Loosely cover bowl with a kitchen towel and set aside to cool to room temperature, stirring occasionally (this will take 4 to 6 hours).. Combine stout beer and 1 tablespoon dark brown sugar in a saucepan set over medium heat. Bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally, until mixture has reduced to 1 cup, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes.. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 2 (9-inch) round cake pans.. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and 3/4 teaspoon salt; set dry ingredients aside.. Beat 1/2 cup unsalted butter, vegetable oil, 1 cup dark brown sugar, and 1/2 cup white sugar together in a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer until light and fluffy, 3 to 4 minutes. Add in eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition, and scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Beat mixture on medium-high speed for 4 to 5 additional minutes after adding in the last egg. Mix in sour cream and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract.. Pour in half of dry ingredients and mix on low until just combined. Pour in cooled stout mixture and mix until just combined. Add in remaining dry ingredients and mix until just combined.. Divide batter evenly between the 2 prepared cake pans. Tap pans on the counter several times to remove any larger air bubbles.. Bake in the preheated oven and until the tops of the cakes spring back lightly when touched, 30 to 35 minutes. Allow cakes to cool in pans for 20 to 30 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely, about 1 hour.. Once cakes and frosting are both cooled, place one cake layer on a serving platter. Top with about 1 cup frosting; spread it into an even layer. Top with remaining cake. Pour remaining frosting over the top of the cake and smooth over top and sides of cake until completely frosted on all sides.

name: White Chocolate Buttercream

steps: Gather all ingredients.. Melt white chocolate in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 15-second intervals, stirring after each interval, 1 to 3 minutes. Set aside to cool.. Place about ½ of the confectioners sugar and butter in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer while gradually adding the remaining sugar in batches, until mixture is smooth.. Add cooled white chocolate and mix until smooth. If frosting is too thick, you can beat in milk, or if the frosting is too runny, beat in more confectioners’ sugar to get the desired consistency.

English Lemon Curd
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'freshly squeezed lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'freshly grated lemon zest'}
steps: Combine lemon juice, eggs, butter, sugar, and lemon zest in a 2-quart saucepan; cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until curd is thick and just beginning to boil, about 8 minutes.. Remove curd from heat and cool to room temperature, stirring occasionally to keep the surface soft, about 30 minutes. Pour curd into clean jars, seal, and store in the refrigerator.

name: Boston Cream Pie Cupcakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg yolks, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'half-and-half cream'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'half-and-half cream'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'almond extract'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg whites, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'dark chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'light corn syrup'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'heavy cream'}
steps: Prepare the pastry cream: Whisk together egg yolks, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pinch of nutmeg until combined. Add in 2 tablespoons of flour and mix until thoroughly incorporated.. Place 1 cup half-and-half in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat until just beginning to simmer, about 5 minutes, then remove from heat. While whisking constantly, carefully and slowly pour hot half-and-half into egg yolk mixture a little at a time, whisking until it is all thoroughly incorporated. Pour mixture back into the saucepan and place over medium-low heat, whisking constantly, until mixture has thickened, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add in 1 tablespoon butter; mix until thoroughly melted and incorporated. Add in remaining 1 tablespoon butter and 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla, and mix until thoroughly combined.. Place a fine mesh strainer over a mixing bowl. Pour pastry cream into the strainer and press through using a spatula to remove any lumps. Cover with plastic wrap, making sure the wrap is in contact with the surface of the pastry cream. Refrigerate until completely chilled, 1 to 2 hours.. Place 1/3 cup cold heavy whipping cream into a bowl, and whip until stiff peaks form. Remove pastry cream from the refrigerator; remove plastic wrap. Fold whipped cream into pastry cream until thoroughly combined. Cover and keep chilled until ready to use.. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (162 degrees C). Line 2 regular 12-cup cupcake pans with liners.. In a large bowl, sift together 1 1/2 cups flour, baking powder, and 3/4 teaspoon salt. Set aside.. Bring 3/4 cup half-and-half, 6 tablespoons butter, 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla, and 1/4 teaspoon almond extract to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium low-heat. Turn off heat; keep warm.. Beat egg whites, whole eggs,  and 1 1/2 cups sugar until light and airy, 5 to 7 minutes. With mixer running on low speed, slowly pour heated half-and-half mixture into the egg mixture until thoroughly combined. Add in half of the dry ingredients; mix until just combined. Add in remaining dry ingredients; mix until just combined, with very few lumps. Batter will be thin.. Working somewhat quickly, divide batter evenly between the 2 prepared cupcake pans, filling each cupcake liner just over half full.. Bake cupcakes in the preheated oven until golden and a toothpick inserted into the center of the cupcake comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes. Allow cupcakes to cool in pan for 5 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.. Once cupcakes are cool, use a cupcake corer or paring knife to remove the center of the cupcakes (making sure not to go all the way through the sides or bottom). Save the top of the cored pieces to use as a 'cap' for the filling, cutting away any extra cupcake as necessary.. Fill a piping bag with the pastry cream. Pipe filling into each cored cupcake. Place cupcake 'cap' over the top of the filling.. To make frosting, place chocolate chips, corn syrup, and 3/4 cup heavy cream into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave mixture at 50% power in 30 second intervals, until melted and combined, 1 1/2 to 2 minutes. Cool chocolate until thickened to a spreadable consistency, 5 to 10 minutes. Frost each filled cupcake with the chocolate frosting.. Keep cupcakes stored in the refrigerator until ready to eat. Bring back to room temperature before serving. The chocolate frosting will harden up substantially in the fridge, and is best served at room temperature.

Whip cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form, 3 to 5 minutes; cover with plastic wrap and chill until ready to serve.

ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh strawberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '3 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar, sifted, divided"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}

name: Mincemeat
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'green apple, peeled and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sultana raisins'}, {'quantity': '1 ⅛', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried currants'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped almonds'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brandy'}

name: Cream Cheese Frosting without Powdered Sugar
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted and cooled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'almond extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'honey'}
steps: Beat cream cheese, butter, brown sugar, vanilla, and almond extract with an electric mixer in a large bowl until mixture begins to stiffen.. Pour in honey. Continue beating until a whipped consistency is reached; do not overmix as it will collapse. Use immediately or store covered in the refrigerator.

name: Fluffy White Frosting
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cream of tartar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg whites'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Stir sugar, water, and cream of tartar together in a saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until sugar is dissolved and syrup is bubbly.. Beat egg whites and vanilla in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until foamy. Gradually add hot syrup mixture, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form, about 7 to 10 minutes.

name: Butter Icing for Sugar Cookies
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'milk, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'drops', 'name': 'red food coloring (Optional)'}
steps: Beat sugar, butter, vanilla, and 1 tablespoon milk in a large bowl until creamy. Mix in more milk, 1 to 2 drops at a time, to reach desired spreading consistency. Stir in food coloring.

name: Easy Chocolate Bundt Cake Glaze
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'name': 'sweetened condensed milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'semisweet chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Combine sweetened condensed milk and chocolate chips in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until the chips are melted and the mixture is smooth. Do not allow it to bubble.. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Cool slightly before drizzling over cake.

name: Fresh Lime Curd
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lime zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}
steps: Place sugar, lime juice, butter, and lime zest in the top of a double boiler; stir over medium-high heat until butter melts.. Temper eggs by mixing 2 tablespoons hot lime mixture into eggs, stir to blend.. Reduce heat to medium until water simmers. Slowly whisk egg mixture into the lime mixture. Cook over the double boiler until lime mixture thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon, 20 to 25 minutes.. Cool slightly and spoon into a clean, glass jar. Cover and refrigerate.

name: Homemade Chocolate Frosting
ingredients: {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'salted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '5 to 7', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}

name: Sugar Cookie Glaze
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'light corn syrup'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'drops', 'name': 'food coloring (Optional)'}
steps: Stir confectioners' sugar, water, and corn syrup together in a bowl until smooth.. Stir in food coloring if desired.

name: Cool Whipped Frosting
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(3.5 ounce) package', 'name': 'instant vanilla pudding mix'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) container', 'name': 'frozen whipped topping, thawed'}

name: Mascarpone Frosting
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(8 ounce) container', 'name': 'mascarpone cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}
steps: Beat together cream, mascarpone, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Add sugar gradually, mixing continuously until frosting is smooth and stiff peaks form, about 5 minutes. Use immediately or store covered in the refrigerator.

name: Glossy Royal Icing
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'warm water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'light corn syrup'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'almond extract'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar, or more as needed"}
steps: Stir together warm water, corn syrup, and almond extract in a small bowl until corn syrup and extract have dissolved.. Place confectioners' sugar into a large bowl and pour in corn syrup mixture. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed until royal icing is smooth. Store in a lidded container for up to a week; stir thoroughly before using.

name: Simple Orange Glaze
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'orange, zested and juiced, divided'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Place confectioners' sugar into a bowl. Add 1 tablespoon orange juice and 1/4 teaspoon orange zest.. Whisk until smooth, adding more juice as necessary. Reserve remaining zest and juice for another use.

name: Anko (Sweet Red Bean Paste)
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried red beans'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Place beans in a saucepan and cover with 2 cups water; bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes.. Drain beans and transfer to a clean saucepan.. Cover with 2 to 3 cups water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer, adding more water as needed, until beans are soft and can be crushed between your fingers, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.. Drain beans and return to the saucepan. Add sugar and set over medium-high heat.. Cook, stirring constantly, until sugar melts and beans form a loose, shiny paste, about 10 minutes.. Immediately transfer paste to a container to cool.

name: Chocolate Frosting with Cocoa Powder
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'margarine, melted'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '3 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar, or more as needed"}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Beat together cocoa and melted margarine in a large bowl until combined.. Add milk and vanilla; beat until smooth.. Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar until desired consistency is achieved. Adjust with more milk or confectioners' sugar if necessary.

name: Cheese Filling
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(8 ounce) packages', 'name': 'cream cheese, room temperature'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg yolk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Beat together cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg yolk and vanilla until well combined. Cover and chill in the refrigerator before using in pastries and baking them.

name: Buttercream Icing
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'milk'}
steps: Beat together butter, shortening, and vanilla with an electric mixer in a large bowl until creamy. Blend in confectioners' sugar, 1 cup at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in milk; continue mixing until icing is light and fluffy. Store icing covered until ready to use.

name: Dairy-Free Vanilla Frosting
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dairy-free margarine'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'water (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Beat confectioners' sugar and dairy-free margarine together using an electric mixer on low speed. Add water to increase creaminess if needed. Add vanilla. Increase speed to high and continue to mix until frosting is stiff. Refrigerate until ready to use.

name: Bavarian Cream
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unflavored gelatin'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg yolks'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'heavy cream'}
steps: Stir together cold water and gelatin in a small bowl; set aside to soften.. Meanwhile, whisk together egg yolks, sugar, and salt in a medium bowl until smooth.. Bring milk to a boil in a medium saucepan. Pour hot milk in a steady stream into yolk mixture, whisking constantly. Return mixture to the saucepan; cook and stir over medium heat until custard thickens slightly and coats the back of a spoon. Strain custard into a large bowl. Stir in softened gelatin and vanilla until gelatin is melted. Allow mixture to cool to room temperature.. Whip heavy cream in a mixing bowl to medium stiffness. Fold into cooled custard and immediately pour into parfait glasses, molds, or onto cake layers before gelatin has time to set. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

name: Coconut Pecan Frosting
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'evaporated milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg yolks'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'flaked coconut'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped pecans'}
steps: Combine milk, sugar, egg yolks, butter, and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring frequently, until thickened, 10 to 15 minutes.. Remove from heat and stir in coconut and pecans.

name: Holland Cream (White Cream Filling)
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable shortening'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'clear vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'water, or more as needed (Optional)'}
steps: Stir sugar and 1/2 cup water together in a saucepan over medium heat until sugar has dissolved and mixture comes to a boil. Remove from the heat and let cool completely, 15 to 30 minutes.. Pour cooled syrup into a large mixing bowl. Add shortening, oil, and vanilla; beat with an electric mixer on high speed until well blended. Beat in confectioners' sugar, 1 cup at a time, until filling is thick and fluffy. Mix in water, 1 tablespoon at a time, if filling is too thick.

name: 3-Ingredient Whipped Cream
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pint', 'name': 'heavy cream'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Place a medium bowl and mixer beaters into the freezer to chill, about 5 minutes.. Pour cream into the chilled bowl and beat with an electric mixer until frothy. Add sugar and vanilla gradually, continuing to beat until soft peaks form.

name: Microwave Lemon Curd
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted and cooled slightly'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'lemon, zested'}
steps: Whisk sugar and eggs together in a microwave-safe bowl until smooth. Stir in lemon juice, melted butter, and lemon zest.. Microwave on high in 1-minute intervals, stirring after each interval, until thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. Pour into small sterile jars.

name: Best Buttercream Frosting
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Whisk milk and flour together in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until mixture starts to thicken, 4 to 5 minutes. Then, whisk vigorously until mixture is lump-free, creamy, sticky, and significantly thicker, 2 to 3 more minutes; it may appear to ball up. Immediately remove from the heat and transfer to a plate; let cool to room temperature.. While the milk mixture is cooling, beat butter and sugar in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer for at least 10 minutes. Mixture should be very fluffy; you may need to mix for 5 more minutes. Gradually mix in cooled milk mixture on high speed; continue to mix until fluffy and smooth. Mix in vanilla.. Cover and refrigerate until frosting reaches a spreading consistency, about 30 minutes.

name: No-Cook Icing
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg white'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cream of tartar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'boiling water'}
steps: Stir sugar, egg white, vanilla, and cream of tartar together in the bowl of a stand mixer. Add boiling water and mix with the whisk attachment until stiff peaks form.

name: Easy Royal Icing
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cream of tartar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'egg whites, beaten'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Sift together confectioners' sugar and cream of tartar in a large bowl.. Beat in egg whites with an electric mixer until mixture is thick enough to hold its shape, about 5 minutes.

name: Chef John's Apple Butter
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'Granny Smith apples, cored and cut into 1-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly grated nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}
steps: Place apple pieces into a large slow cooker. Add white sugar, brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and vinegar. Add water and mix well.. Cover and cook on High until apples are starting to soften and release liquid, 1 to 2 hours. Reduce heat to Low and cook, uncovered, until all the apple flesh is dissolved, 5 to 6 hours. Stir occasionally.. Puree using an immersion blender until smooth. Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until darkened and thick, about 4 hours more. Pass apple butter through a strainer if desired. Seal in a glass container and refrigerate until cool.

name: Brownie Frosting
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Stir together sugar, milk, and butter in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil. Cook at a rolling boil for 30 seconds, then immediately remove from the heat.. Add chocolate chips and vanilla to the saucepan; stir until chips are completely melted. Pour immediately over warm brownies.

name: Best White Icing Ever
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'clear imitation vanilla extract'}
steps: Place confectioners' sugar, shortening, water, and vanilla into a large bowl. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed to combine, then beat on medium speed for a full 5 minutes.

name: Lemon Custard Filling
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cornstarch'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg yolks'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}
steps: Combine sugar, cornstarch, and salt in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until sugar is melted, 3 to 5 minutes.. Whisk water and egg yolks together in a small bowl; pour into sugar the mixture, whisking until fully incorporated. Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens, 3 to 5 minutes.. Remove from the heat and stir in lemon juice and butter until incorporated. Cover with plastic wrap and let sit until completely cooled.

name: Royal Icing with Meringue Powder
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "sifted confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'meringue powder'}
steps: Beat together confectioners' sugar, water, and meringue powder in a large bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form, 7 to 10 minutes.

name: Wedding Cake Icing
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'clear imitation vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'almond extract'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sifted powdered sugar, divided'}
steps: Combine shortening, water, vanilla, salt, and almond extract in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment; beat until smooth and creamy. Gradually mix in 1/2 of the powdered sugar, then continue to mix for a minimum of 5 minutes (or preferably up to 10 minutes).. Mix in remaining powdered sugar just until combined. Add additional water if needed to reach desired spreading consistency.

name: Grocery Store Frosting
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shortening'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Gather the ingredients.. Combine shortening, butter, water, and vanilla in a heavy-duty mixer.. Add sugar and salt and beat until well mixed. Add 1 to 2 more tablespoons water if needed to get desired consistency.. Turn mixer to the highest speed and beat for 15 minutes.
